description: Two dogs, depicted with halos and wings, are seated on a cloud, suggesting they are in heaven. One dog reflects on its past life, detailing its dedication to chasing cars of specific brands like Pontiacs, Fords, and Chryslers for twelve years. The irony is revealed as the dog's death, which led it to this afterlife, is attributed not to the dangerous pursuit itself, but to an action taken by its "stupid owner" yesterday, creating an absurd juxtaposition between a long-held animal instinct and a sudden, unexpected demise caused by another party.
caption: "For twelve perfect years I was a car-chaser. Pontiacs, Fords, Chryslers—I took 'em all on ... and yesterday my stupid owner
